website_summaries.verdict: A hatchet for the occasional user on a budget.
pros: Sharp enough to get the job done straight out of the box

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy this!!
customer_reviews.text: It is a Chinese stainless steel hatchet. No indication of what type of stainless. It is also represented as carbon steel (it is not). When we tried to return it, we could not get a return label, only a QR code square. We are in a rural area, and it would cost more in gas to find a place that the QR code could be scanned, than the hatchet is worth. Impossible to return!! Not worth buying.
customer_reviews.author: Bob S.

customer_reviews.title: Blade doesn’t hold up even under “normal” use.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a Christmas gift for my husband. He uses it only to splinter off wood to start campfires. After just one use the blade is so warped and chipped that it cannot be used. Very disappointed in quality especially since Bear Grylls has his name affiliated with this hatched.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for use around the fire pit
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my boyfriend to use for chopping wood to toss in the fire pit. Its great for chopping smaller branches and sticks. I do not think it could be used for actually chopping larger pieces of wood or chopping old trees. This would work well for smaller items or smaller type trees. It is light enough for me to hold but I have a hard time using it with one hand.
customer_reviews.author: SarahMonroe

customer_reviews.title: Will come through in a jam
customer_reviews.text: What can you say it's a Gerber. I switched out my other set up for lighter gear . I wasn't sure is this little baby was gona cut it in the field. We humped back up 15 miles to a Glacier lake late spring. We got hit with a hard cold storm that was not on the radar. The temp dropped to -20 in less than 2 hrs. I did not have my severe weather gear with me. I had to make an emergency shelter with blue tarps para cord and sash. This unit was up to the task. It was a fast moving storm but It was so comfortable in the shelter we stayed the night. Thanks Gerber
customer_reviews.author: Captain Bad

customer_reviews.title: the hatchet was excellent for shaving small kindling
customer_reviews.text: I thought I could use this hatchet to chop standard cut firewood logs into quarters, but that didn't work well. It's not this hatchet's fault. Instead, need the right tool for the right job, and this didn't meet the need. However, the hatchet was excellent for shaving small kindling, pounding tent steaks and was sharp enough to cut quarter-inch laundry line at the camp site. Quite a handy convenience tool that worked well for my limited needs. For sure though, will purchase bigger and purpose-built hatchet for splitting logs that are already cut-to-size campfire logs.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen J. Otoole

customer_reviews.title: One of my favorite Bear Grylls items
customer_reviews.text: This is one of my favorite Bear Grylls items. this is compact and straps to the side of my hiking pack easily without being noticeable while out on long treks. This allows you to access it easily without sacrificing room inside the pack that can be utilized for other things. One of the best features on this item is the ergo finger grips near the base of the blade that allow you to maneuver it easily when you're working on something that takes a little more finesse than just hacking and chopping.
customer_reviews.author: The Rambling Hiker

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my Zombie Apoc Kit!
customer_reviews.text: Wanted a small hatchet to keep in my car and this seems perfect. Fits nicely in the under trunk floor storage compartment in my SUV, along with a shovel, Bear Grylls survival knife, extra clothes, fire starter, emergency food and a few other items - I like to explore the vast empty deserts and mountains in my state and so I go prepared. Also used it on a recent camping trip to chop kindling. Well made and a good addition to my "zombie apocalypse" escape kit in my vehicle.
customer_reviews.author: David G.

customer_reviews.title: Totally Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: Gerber makes the best products & this axe is no exception! It’s just totally awesome! It’s so intimidating, I plan to use this as a deterrent to crime! I don’t think anyone will want to mess with me with this baby in my hand! It’s really sharp right out of the package, the weight and handle is just perfect! Feels so good in your hand! No complaints whatsoever on this baby!!!! 😎😎😎
customer_reviews.author: RC

customer_reviews.title: Small and compact, uncomfortable to use.
customer_reviews.text: It's a nice small size and would work great for extended trips when space is limited. The biggest downside is how uncomfortable it is to use. After a few good thwacks into a solid piece of wood my hand is stinging. Terrible for general use as a hatchet, decent as a go bag survival axe.
customer_reviews.author: Victor

customer_reviews.title: High quality small hatchet!
customer_reviews.text: Great small hatchet! High quality and has taken the abuse I have thrown at it for 3 winter camping trips. I like it for splitting smaller pieces of firewood. If I had one critique is that with trees and limbs over 3-4 inches it struggles to have the chopping power that a slightly larger axe would. All on all great quality small hatchet.
customer_reviews.author: Quinn Swenson

customer_reviews.title: ONLY BUY FROM AMAZON SHIPPED BY AMAZON!!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had this hatchet/axe for about 2 years now! I will buy another just to have kept away!! Must have for survival or camping!!!
customer_reviews.author: Chase

customer_reviews.title: Very nice hatchet
customer_reviews.text: I love this hatchet, I haven't had a chance to use it, but it came very sharp, and it feel great in my hands, I bought it to attach to an emergency bug out bag, to where if ever in an emergency, I am prepared, the way our world is today, you just never really know what's gonna happen.
customer_reviews.author: Casper G

customer_reviews.title: Amazon understate damage from used item - blade curled
customer_reviews.text: Amazon understate damage from used item - blade curled. I’m going to have to put more into it to fix it than it cost!!!!
customer_reviews.author: brian johnson

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy little axe
customer_reviews.text: This thing is awesome. Specifically when camping; we made a game of throwing this at a large stump, which bounced off the stump and around on the ground more than it stuck into the stump. Even after playing for a few hours, the axe was still pretty sharp and held up well.
customer_reviews.author: Ty C.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my wife's kit
customer_reviews.text: I'm giving this a 5 star rating because it fulfills everything I wanted in a light-weight hatchet. It is perfect for my wife's camping/bugout bag as it is lightweight, sharp (and easy to sharpen) and has multiple campsite uses other than just chopping. It is very ergonomic and handles very well. I carry a much beefier Schrade hatchet for heavier work, but this one just fit the bill so well for our back-up hatchet.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not a survival hatchet.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my son to carry while fishing and camping to clear brush. Not a survival hatchet by any means but ok for minor tasks. If your looking for a survival hatchet or something for in your bug out bag, skip on this. Blade is made of stainless steel so I knew before purchasing it wasnt going to be as strong as a quality forged steel made blade. Works for what he needs it for.
customer_reviews.author: Buttchinbart

customer_reviews.title: Tooo Tiny
customer_reviews.text: We sent it back it is more of a teeny tiny hatchet not very useful for our needs.
customer_reviews.author: Eileen w.

customer_reviews.title: Great hatchet...ok sheath.
customer_reviews.text: This hatchet came out of the box and went right to use on a camping trip the next day. Let me tell you, I put it though its paces too. The grip feels good and the axe has a nice weight to it. It didn't fail me once. What I most like about this is the finger cut outs on the underside of the blade. I do wish that the case was a little more substantial though.
customer_reviews.author: Nick W.

customer_reviews.title: A sweet little tool.
customer_reviews.text: Not a bad little hatchet at all. Like most of the Bear Grylls survival line, this is actually a pretty serious tool, not gimmicky and made like garbage like I first expected. It came with a nice sharp edge, and is the perfect size to chop smaller branches off of larger logs. I also find I get a good deal more power behind my swings then I expected. I will say though, the "hammer" is really thin and leaves much to be desired in that regard. I use this with my Solo Stove wood gasifier, and it is the perfect size for cutting wood that fits in the stove (very small branches, no more than 1" thick usually).
customer_reviews.author: Matthew K.

customer_reviews.title: Works ok, but don't sell your axe..
customer_reviews.text: Small, light weight camp tool. Good to chop some kindling for a camp fire. Not for splitting wood. Use an axe for that. Can be kept in a backpack or toolbox without taking up much space. Very sharp, keep the cover on it when not in use. Handle has nice grip to it. The back is a bit narrow to use for a hammer, but it does work if you don't have anything else. Its compact size is what I wanted.
customer_reviews.author: tm

customer_reviews.title: A BG beast
customer_reviews.text: Bear Grylls products can be hit-or-miss. This product though is an absolute Superstar. You can keep it on your belt, it's not too heavy. And it gets the job done with ease. All of the claims in the promo videos are legit, I've tested it myself on many occasions. I've been using it for about a little over 2 years and it is fantastic. Sharpens up nice and quick as well.
customer_reviews.author: Alex & Candy

customer_reviews.title: Great for BOB and camping
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my car and eventual camping. So far I haven't used it to baton anything so I'm trusting Gerber for the blade quality. I'll update this post if anything bad happens. So far, the product look good and balanced. It has a nice design with two dents between the blade and the handle where you put your middle and ring fingers while extending your point finger with the blade. This type of handle comes very confortable and gives your a better "feel" when doing precise wood work, like when scraping wood for tinder. The only bad thing was that after buying this at amazon for $20 I saw it at Wallmart for only $10. Good buy.
customer_reviews.author: Juan Castro

customer_reviews.title: Good size for what I use it for
customer_reviews.text: I only use this during hunting season. It is fine for clearing shooting lanes of new growth and getting firewood for the evening's fire. I can't see using it to fell trees, but works fine on 3 or 4 inch saplings. Fits against my backpack and doesn't stick out where it can get caught on trees or brush as I more through the woods.
customer_reviews.author: Bert's Analysis

customer_reviews.title: BEAR GRYLLS IS RIGHT ABOUT THIS ONE
customer_reviews.text: ITS BEEN A OVER A YEAR ALREADY SINCE I BOUGHT THIS HATCHET, I DON USUALLY REVIEW THINGS RIGHT AFTER PURCHASING. THIS HAS BEEN OF THE NICEST HATCHETS I HAVE EVER OWN. PRETTY STRONG AND THIS THINGS HAS BEEN THROUGH A LOT OF ABUSE. CHOPPING WOOD, OLD CABINETS, BRINGING DOWN TREE BRANCHES. ITS PRETTY TIGHT ON THE GRIP HANDLE AND THE COLOR ORANGE WHICH IS A PLUS HAS SAVE ME A LOT OF TIME WHEN I HAVE DROPPED IT SEVERAL TIMES IN THE DARK AND MAKES IT EASIER TO FIND IT. ONE BAD THING THOUGH ITS THE COVER THAT IT COMES WITH, ITS JUST HARD TO PUT ON AND REMOVE
customer_reviews.author: Adventure Seeker

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for yard work.
customer_reviews.text: I use this sucker for all my chopping needs. It's great. Cuts down small trees. And i haven't lost any fingers yet. So this girl gives it 2 thumbs up!
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer05

customer_reviews.title: Cheap Junk
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my camper. Blade is garbage, soft and dull. Handle is poorly designed and uncomfortable. I am returning it.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Branigan

customer_reviews.title: Too Light to do Anything Really With It
customer_reviews.text: We bought this to kindle some small logs. It really is to light to do anything with it. Looks cool, but just not very useful outside of maybe some really light use.
customer_reviews.author: JOHN RUTHERFORD

customer_reviews.title: badass!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this for my boyfriend because he loves Gerber products (especially bear grylls) and he is also big into survival gear. Its sharp, sturdy, and high quality. What more could you need? Its not for chopping down trees so people shouldn't take stars off for that. This is a hatchet not an Axe. Its more for chopping branches. But its awesome and we both like it.
customer_reviews.author: heavymetalmaniac

customer_reviews.title: Great Design, Well Balanced.
customer_reviews.text: Four stars for the design of this hatchet. I've found that a medium sized, heavy machete will do the same job and is also more versatile. The "hammer" end of the hatched is very thin and I would NOT try to drive stakes or certainly nails with it. But the hatchet excels at chopping kindling, 1-3 inch trees, etc. I suppose this hatchet has all the obvious possibilities that you can imagine. It's best feature is it's small size and weight, making it a hikers important tool. Skilled persons can get this tool razor sharp very quickly.
customer_reviews.author: T. McCord

customer_reviews.title: Good for the money
customer_reviews.text: I think for money its gonna be a good little hatchet i took away one star because it dont stand up to heavy use its not ment for spliting i splitting i split a piece of cherry wood with it and the top edge of the blade got a nick in it comes razor sharp with shave the hair off ur arms but if ur looking for a more serious hatchet id get a schrade scaxe2 it handles heavier tasks with ease
customer_reviews.author: alex dewey

customer_reviews.title: extremely sturdy and unlikely to ever break -Excellent grip with lanyard ...
customer_reviews.text: Pros -Full tang, extremely sturdy and unlikely to ever break -Excellent grip with lanyard hold -Durable blade, though it is thin and wont bite very deep and the edge might roll over more easily than a stouter hatchet, still better than most knives at these tasks -Finger grooves on neck so you can use it like a clumsy knife Cons -Too small for heavy duty work, though it is not intended for such so no points off -Sheath can be kind of annoying to get off as you have to push the head and handle up through it, minor issue
customer_reviews.author: Allen

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy
customer_reviews.text: Chinesium steel. Looses its edge way too quickly and too heaving for a hatchet this size. I should have watched and read more reviews before wasting my money of any Bear Grylls products.
customer_reviews.author: Adam Avital

customer_reviews.title: Better as a trowing hatchet than a useful tool...
customer_reviews.text: Meh... Just took this camping, it's sharp enough, but the head is very thin so it is not good at splitting sticks/logs in order to make kindling. It is also pretty short, so hard to get a good chop swing. Basically, if you have to take something backpacking I guess this would be good because it is small and somewhat light, but it does not do a good job at typical hatchet duties.
customer_reviews.author: OregonJIG

customer_reviews.title: Don't cut your hand
customer_reviews.text: Packs nicely wears nicely on your belt it also fits my hand very well I can baton with it or hammer camp stakes with it or hammer anything with it for that matter seems to hold an edge very well just be careful getting it out of the sheath it is extremely Sharp and the design of the sheet can hurt your camping trip if it slices your hand. Took one star off for the sheath design which to me does seem important so you don't cut your hand
customer_reviews.author: Rick D

customer_reviews.title: Terrible product
customer_reviews.text: Poor quality. Broke in first 5 hacks at a tree. Terrible product. And quite heavily..... for nothing
customer_reviews.author: Enrique Padilla

customer_reviews.title: you will easily have dents in the blade
customer_reviews.text: Here is my video review:  Bottom-line: The hatchet is made out of stainless steel...therefore, you will easily have dents in the blade. The hatchet does not really work well as a hammer. If you are planning on buying this hatchet for a bug-out bag, bushcrafting, etc., I would focus on purchasing a hatchet made out of 1095 - 1050 steel. This hatchet is more of an item that looks pretty rather than practical. On the good side, the hatchet is sharp out of the box.
customer_reviews.author: Mark and Julie

customer_reviews.title: Smaller than expected
customer_reviews.text: A lot smaller than I expected. Bought it as a gift for my husband. He usually loves Bear Grylls stuff but his first reaction was it was really small. We'll be using it for camping in a few weeks.
customer_reviews.author: Christine

customer_reviews.title: Very good hatchet! Light and strong
customer_reviews.text: Very good hatchet! Light and strong. I took it into the Big Horn mountains camping and have taken it camping numerous times as well. It does a good job of cutting firewood. Being a hatchet, of course, it is limited on the size of logs or branches it can cut up without some effort. But it worked great for us and I knew that coming in. It did lose a lot of its sharpness after our first camping trip which rendered it fairly ineffective or inefficient, however after sharpening it again, it worked just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Joe S.

customer_reviews.title: This hatchet is the one!
customer_reviews.text: What a fantastic hatchet and a awesome sale as well. Hatchet came sharpened with a sheath that works well with my existing equipment. If I ever have to buy another this one is it.
customer_reviews.author: big blind jon

customer_reviews.title: Great emergency tool
customer_reviews.text: This is great for an emergency situation I have it for an extra incase my other large hatchett breaks you can definitely beat on this one it'll take it
customer_reviews.author: William S.

customer_reviews.title: Great for back packing, but if weight aint and issue, get something else.
customer_reviews.text: This is pretty awesome, it is so light. My buddy head a longer heavier one that I've say was better for cutting through down wood, but mine was cool for making shavings for tinder, debarking my walking stick and splitting. I'd say if weight isn't an issue get a bigger one and bring a bush knife, but if you want to keep your pack light, this is AWESOME.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: very good when your stuck in alaskan wilderness
customer_reviews.text: i took this to alaska as part of my survival kit but i wasnt lucky enough to get to use it. looks like it would do what its designed for though
customer_reviews.author: S K

customer_reviews.title: Check out other choices first.
customer_reviews.text: Really, really small. I expected more of a medium size, but this is almost just for looks. Just my .02. Wouldn’t buy again.
customer_reviews.author: JD

customer_reviews.title: Great truck hatchet!
customer_reviews.text: Great little truck hatchet with a razor sharp bit chops through wood with absolutely no problem at all and full tang construction means the temperature swings won’t cause a normaly wooden handled hatchet to get damaged. I use it camping for firewood all the time and it works fantasticly!
customer_reviews.author: Jeremiah fix

customer_reviews.title: A Good Roughing Out Hatchet for beginning bushcraft wood carvers
customer_reviews.text: I use this as a roughing out carving axe because I am a beginning wood carver spoon and kuksa carver but I didn't want to purchase the gransfors axe at 4 times the price. I am a woman and this axe is light enough that I don't face arm fatigue and sharp enough to do what I ask of it. Holds a good edge and sharpens easily. A perfect first roughing out tool! Great price, quality tool.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice camp/survival item
customer_reviews.text: Great hatchet with many small features that make it more user friendly. The blade is very sharp and if clean can double as a knife, just chock your hand up close to the head for more control and use just like you would a knife. We had to use this to cut down a tree because it was the only thing we had on hand and I forgot the key to my trail cam lock 350 miles away. Took some elbow grease but when done my brother was impressed and bought one for himself.
customer_reviews.author: BuckSnort

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: I still have and use this as my only hand axe. It is simply perfect in every way, especially the finger grooves for closer work. Amazing piece and another great addition to the Grylls line.
customer_reviews.author: buwanidaddy

customer_reviews.title: Small, lightweight and sharp. Softer steel
customer_reviews.text: It’s a good little pack hatchet. Lightweight and comes sharp out of the package. The steel isn’t the strongest and the head isn’t too heavy but this isn’t made to be robust. I like the tool and I will keep it and put it to use.
customer_reviews.author: Ikindaliketacos

customer_reviews.title: I’m Extremely Pleased With It..
customer_reviews.text: I’ve Not Used It Yet But I Can’t Wait to see how it preforms... In My 1st Review I Had Said That Mine Didn’t Arrive Sharpe - But I Was Wrong - It’s Extremely Sharpe & I’m Very Pleased With It
customer_reviews.author: D49

customer_reviews.title: Survival Gear - Emergency Kit Essential.
customer_reviews.text: Looks mean, solidly built, and sturdy carrying case. I actually built this for my emergency kit, you know, in case SHTF. Anyways I think it could take out several zombies pretty well in an attack. Good grip on the handle, and a sturdy solid metal 1 piece looks like it would hold up quite nicely. Gerber makes some pretty legit stuff, and I would highly recommend this if you were looking for a hatchet.
customer_reviews.author: M. White

customer_reviews.title: Good quality.
customer_reviews.text: Worked very well for me. Compact, and served well on camping trips. Might need a sharpening stone though, the edge is a touch soft, which his good for not shattering things, but bad for others. Still, very good price, excellent quality.
customer_reviews.author: J.D.

customer_reviews.title: To small
customer_reviews.text: It’s so small it really won’t do the job of cutting anything
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Lifetime Warranty!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Amazing knife, and with a “Lifetime Warranty” what else can I say? Everything about the knife feels amazing! I got it for $23 on Amazon when they dropped the price for a day! It goes now for $39
customer_reviews.author: Alejandro G.

customer_reviews.title: Chop Sticks!
customer_reviews.text: " CHOP, CHOP, CHOP them there trees for fire wood! ". What a cool little gizmo this charming hatchet has become in my arsenal of survival stuff it is just the greatest thing since sliced bread a must have as well. A great little design for just about every unknown survival aspects that may arises in survival procedures during the Dawn, Morning, Evening and lastly the Night this without a chopping doubt is truly a all day and night-er tool of excellence. Way to go!
customer_reviews.author: DAVEOREOUS

customer_reviews.title: If you want a high quality portable hatchet this is it!
customer_reviews.text: Incredible quality! Very Sharp! Looks great! Feels great in the hand! Greatly weighted for chopping power! I have used a few hatchets in my life and I have NEVER been impressed with performance until using this. There are cheaper hatchets, but if you want a high quality hatchet, this is it! Love it! I took this camping and I was able to very easily cut up wood for our fire. Works great!
customer_reviews.author: Carl and Jenny

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful Tool
customer_reviews.text: As described. Would definitely buy from again. Love this little hatchet
customer_reviews.author: jessica h.

customer_reviews.title: Great Hatchet, worth the cost.
customer_reviews.text: This hatchet was delivered quickly. The hatched it made of high grade steel, has a great weight to it while still being easily portable. It splits small logs and branches with ease, allowing me to quickly create tinder and kindling. I feel this is a perfect hatchet for its intended use. You won't split a 6 in. diameter log with it, but for a weekend camping/backpacking trip, it is well worth the cost.
customer_reviews.author: CovertLeopard

customer_reviews.title: Many uses
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful hatchet light easy to carry. Ultra sharp and hold the edge
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Broke after using it 2 times
customer_reviews.text: After just a few uses it broke and I wasn’t chopping down anything substantial. Was a Christmas gift and broke of course after the return policy expired.
customer_reviews.author: Linda

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Camping/backpacking
customer_reviews.text: Great handheld hatchet! I spent a few days backpacking and needed wood each morning/night. Perfect for chopping small dead trees and making kindling to get the fire going and useful for setting the stakes for the tent in tougher ground. Not super light weight but compared to other models that cost $$$ then it is perfect. Make sure you sharpen it every once in a while.
customer_reviews.author: Ben

customer_reviews.title: shorty.
customer_reviews.text: the handle is to short to be really useful, although if that's the only thing you have with you, it's better than nothing. It can chop branches if you need to, but expect to be sore after a little while.
customer_reviews.author: Xzzwxs

customer_reviews.title: Get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.text: Great for a bugout bag. Sharp and a good feel to it whe using. Respect your equipment it will last longer or long enough to save up for a new one.
customer_reviews.author: GERMAN HAMMER

customer_reviews.title: Great hatchet!!
customer_reviews.text: Very cool. Bought this for my husband and he loves it! I'm not sure that he has used it yet, but he is very happy and it seems to be extremely well-made. He wants to be able to use it to build shelters in the woods like Bear does and/or killing zombies when and if it's necessary LOL. It comes with a nice case or scabbard that covers and protects the blade (and your body), has belt loops and lets the handle come out of the bottom. We love Bear Grylls of course too!!
customer_reviews.author: kimberly

customer_reviews.title: Nice hatchet
customer_reviews.text: I use it to chop/break the pelvic bone when field dressing deer. It is thin and easy to carry. Being thin, however, it is of no use splitting firewood logs.
customer_reviews.author: Howard

customer_reviews.title: A bit small but still powerful
customer_reviews.text: Little small to want to use this for big projects but as a camp tool to trim the branches off of small logs it works well and came nice and sharp. I would not recommend using this for anything more than a small to medium sized chunk of wood but the size makes it good for hiking.
customer_reviews.author: Beef5718

customer_reviews.title: overhyped
customer_reviews.text: not that sharp, it is slightly ergonomic, was not made to split which is what u need in survival, that axe needs to be wider
customer_reviews.author: George Morris

customer_reviews.title: Just what I wanted
customer_reviews.text: I did a lot of research on hatchets before I made this purchase. There are several that seem comparable, but this one was the most compact and a great price. Although the head is light, and probably takes a few extra swings to split wood, the blade is razor sharp, and the quality is overall excellent! I took it camping, and all the guys wanted to take turns chopping firewood with it. If I was into day to day bushcraft I'd probably spring for an expensive Swedish axe, but as a outdoor hobbiest this was a perfect purchase!
customer_reviews.author: abombing

customer_reviews.title: Survival tool yes, a great “I intend to hurt you or fight for my life and win it’s so sharp”
customer_reviews.text: Sharper than sharp. I cut myself three times using this. Trying to hammer tent stakes was a no go. That’s why it was purchased.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel

customer_reviews.title: Awesome . Thanks again Gerber / SEABEE
customer_reviews.text: For the small tasks , this Item surpasses its need For the larger task , this Item would be nice to have if lost for one or two day's . That said ~ I won't leave home without it on a hunting trip , or a camping trip ..
customer_reviews.author: Seabee

customer_reviews.title: Excellant tool
customer_reviews.text: Very effective on the farm and in the woods. Very pleased with purchase but be warned it is strong and SHARP
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: learning to juggle so I bought 2
customer_reviews.text: When my first Grylls Gerber hatchet arrived I was blown away - beautifully sculpted lines, a nice grippy handle, and razor sharp. Around the camp this is my workhorse: great for splitting smaller wood, the skinny profile and nonstick coating prevents it from getting stuck. Bash twigs with the butt end to make tinder. Unlike the Schrade SCAXE2 it doesn't have a firesteel in the handle, just use natural materials lying around eg. a Bic.
customer_reviews.author: F.D.K

customer_reviews.title: Good, lightweight hatchet
customer_reviews.text: Great for the backpacker who wants a hatchet or axe, but is conscious of weight concerns. This is light, yet ample enough to split kindling. You can choke up on the handle and use this as a knife. Seems to sharpen easilty. Grip is excellent. Sheath is okay, but the grip makes for a slow presentation (no fast draw here), and the loops on the sheath are not for wide belts. Overall, a great backpacking tool.
customer_reviews.author: MrTruth

customer_reviews.title: Almost perfect.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little tool if you are planning to pack in somewhere to camp or hunt. My only gripe about it is the width of the hammer side of the ax. it's very narrow. I ended up returning it b/c of that but the whole ax is nice an compact, lightweight, and even has a belt loop in the sheath which is a very nice idea. If the hammer head was a little fatter, I would have kept it.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Schmoe

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight, durable & comes with a solid edge.
customer_reviews.text: This thing rules! It has replaced my regular sized hatchet & is perfect for backpacking & camping. It has exceeded my expectations.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice Hatchet That Comes With A Free Bottle Of Piss
customer_reviews.text: Great little hatchet for the price, I bought the BG edition because it was cheaper than the normal one, and like usual Gerber gets the job done. .
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Hollibaugh

customer_reviews.title: This hatchet definitely works, but it doesn’t excel. ...
customer_reviews.text: This hatchet definitely works, but it doesn’t excel. It lacks mass in the blade end, so you have to apply more force with your arm. This makes your hand endure extra shock from the already rigid and uncomfortable handle.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon

customer_reviews.title: I recommend this item
customer_reviews.text: I recommend this item ... this is one of my many tools in my Survival Kit...It is not tactical or practical to depend on one tool for all your survival tasks ...Good to have can’t be for a price
customer_reviews.author: Zhenman

customer_reviews.title: I was very impressed
customer_reviews.text: Very nice!!!! It is light and small perfect for the backpack. Very very sharp! Feels good in the hand. It is very thin in the blade, which makes it sharp but will fold a bit during hard use, but this is for "just in case " not everyday hard use. Because it is light and small it will be there when I do need it. Feels good to have a tool like this with me. Sheath is average and able to attach to belt!
customer_reviews.author: Chris Bordeaux

customer_reviews.title: Very nice
customer_reviews.text: Love just hatched very very short can't wait to go do my thing
customer_reviews.author: ROBERT ERICKSON

customer_reviews.title: Small high-quality sturdy hatchet
customer_reviews.text: I like this hatchet. Good feel in hand, looks sturdy, and it suits the purpose I need it for (car emergency kit with other items). It is small though, smaller than I expected - not a problem for my purpose but can't see chopping logs with it - suggest you read the measurements before buying.
customer_reviews.author: Frank Kennedy

customer_reviews.title: I was able to quickly and easily shave a 2x4 down to a point without ever ...
customer_reviews.text: ---Update after 3 years of ownership; Hatchet is still my go-to for all my smaller needs. I dont go to the woods without it. No chips, dings, dents, crack, etc. Would still buy again. --- Very Very sharp! I was able to quickly and easily shave a 2x4 down to a point without ever swinging it. Hatchet is full tang construction and nicely weighted. Hatchet is also nice and small, I leave in my BOB.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Love Gerber tools
customer_reviews.text: Love Gerber tools. I own two Gerber knives and fire starter so it wasn't difficult to look towards this company when needing to purchase a hatchet. It is light but with good weight for chopping wood and making kindling. It is sturdy and handles very well. I especially like the grip as the size is smaller than I am used to in a hatchet. Comes with a blade cover that attaches to belt or pack.
customer_reviews.author: robin calvanese

customer_reviews.title: Very handy tool to own
customer_reviews.text: I wish it were a bit sharper but I can fix that. Otherwise it’s a handy tool,
customer_reviews.author: ForeverYoung

customer_reviews.title: Nice and solid
customer_reviews.text: Nice and solid. Good weight to it. I haven’t used it yet but will update when I do. Seems very sturdy with a good grip on the handle.
customer_reviews.author: Angela PV

customer_reviews.title: No good
customer_reviews.text: First 5 mins I used is camping. Broke. Don’t buy
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very good product
customer_reviews.text: Very good product no complaints we are going to go feels good man is a very sturdy true and very sharp
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Sharp and Awesome
customer_reviews.text: I love this hatchet in the woods, and at home. I use it to make extra thin kindling for starting fires in the wood stove -- it easily makes slivers in spruce or cedar that are just a grain width wide -- like popsicle stick thick. I don't use any paper starting fires anymore.
customer_reviews.author: o.m.

customer_reviews.title: Gerber Bear Grylis Survival Hatchet & Nylon Sheath
customer_reviews.text: This small but very handy hatchet is great for carrying in your back pack! Just the right size for getting skin off an animal and for splitting the pelvis. Sharp and very durable steel. I like the compact size, yet big enough to get jobs of cutting & splitting done without difficulty. Sheath is made of durable material too. I can recommend this hatchet to all outdoorsmen. You'll appreciate this hatchet once you use it.
customer_reviews.author: Warren V. Judd

customer_reviews.title: nice little hatchet
customer_reviews.text: I really like the size of this hatchet. It is small and lightweight, but is easy to wield. It is good in its role as a survival/camping hatchet and surprisingly sharp out of the packaging. I very much like the full tang design, meaning that the entire hatchet is one piece, which makes it stronger. I would recommend this product for someone who wants a small hatchet for camping, light chopping. Very happy with it so far.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Works like a charm.
customer_reviews.text: It’s light weight and gets the job done. I used it to chop some thin trees.
customer_reviews.author: GMC13

customer_reviews.title: Love this hatchet
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love this product ended up giving away as a present bought a second one for myself
customer_reviews.author: Jared T

customer_reviews.title: Not bad but not an axe
customer_reviews.text: Gave this 4 stars because it’s not really an axe at all. It’s more of a knife. Love the sharp edge and the handle, you can really do good fine work with it. But not an axe doesn’t split very well with the thin blade.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick S.

customer_reviews.title: This survival hatchet is wonderfully small and easily packed
customer_reviews.text: This survival hatchet is wonderfully small and easily packed. It is very sharp and wonderfully useful as it can be used as a large knife as well as a hatchet due to the finger notches and the sharpness of the blade. However, be aware that due to the narrow bevel it doesn't split logs overly well. The same size hatchet with a slightly larger bevel would be a welcome upgrade.
customer_reviews.author: Bike Enthusiast

customer_reviews.title: Comes extremely sharp and has a good feel to it
customer_reviews.text: Comes extremely sharp and has a good feel to it. Balance is nice while swinging and the hammer on the other end is useful for pounding tent stakes. The only issue I have with it is the sheath. Sheath is small and of lower quality and has a awkward way of going in and out of the sheath. Very tight fitting and must be slid down from the top.
customer_reviews.author: Inspector Gadget

customer_reviews.title: Gave as gifts!
customer_reviews.text: Amazon had a deal on these, so I got the max number (3?), and gave to family as camping gifts.
customer_reviews.author: C. Kotan

customer_reviews.title: Good but too compact to be really effective.
customer_reviews.text: It's OK but handle really needs to be minimum two inches longer (pref. more, like six) for decent leverage/swing. I've bought other BG labeled outdoors products and they've been solid.
customer_reviews.author: Pedro De Bubba

customer_reviews.title: Great little axe
customer_reviews.text: Great little axe, well balanced and small enough to fit into your hand, but big enough to use. I use this for cutting thru bush when hiking though I think it would struggle on large logs. FORGET the sheath, seems cheap and the loops are barely big enough to fit a child's belt. It also gets coaught when putting in and taking out so use it for storage only. Good finger cutouts make it easy to use when "shaving" kindling etc but a bigger thumb area would have been good.
customer_reviews.author: JohnSAS

customer_reviews.title: Very nice and useful.
customer_reviews.text: Very nice and useful. Love that it has two ways to hold. Super sharp.
customer_reviews.author: Antonio

customer_reviews.title: Perfect balance and just right for that extra ax you ...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased 5 of these. One for each of my son's for a Christmas present and one for myself. I have mine in my truck to use when needed. Perfect balance and just right for that extra ax you need to chop something
customer_reviews.author: Michael Nesbit

customer_reviews.title: Best hatchet to date32
customer_reviews.text: Bought this Hatchet during the holiday season of 2013. Looked everywhere for this exact product and the prices ranged from $50 to $70. Went on Amazon they had it for $32 at the time. My husband loves Gerber and when he opened the package for this hatchet he was very please with the quality of this product. It was sharp, sturdy, came with a sheath. He couldn't have been any happier.
customer_reviews.author: Miranda Jackson-Boone

product_meta.title: Gerber Bear Grylls Survival Hatchet [31-002070]
product_meta.description: Making a fire or building a shelter can be life saving parts of a survival experience. With a slim profile and full tang construction, the Survival Hatchet is just the right size for survival situations. The grippy rubber handle ensures it won’t slip, even when wet. Includes a durable nylon sheath to keep the razor sharp blade safe when not in use.
feature_bullets: 3.5" blade for swift, precise cuts + easy portability.
Full tang, high carbon steel construction for durability.
Ergonomic, non-slip rubber grip is secure in wet/dry conditions.
Mildew-resistant nylon sheath w/ belt loops for accessibility.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars1,532 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
